Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 127 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 127 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 255 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 255 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

resource.description: An example resource schema demonstrating some basic constructs and validation rules.

properties.name: AllowVersionUpgrade
properties.description: Major version upgrades can be applied during the maintenance window to the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the cluster. Default value is True

type.description: Major version upgrades can be applied during the maintenance window to the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the cluster. Default value is True

properties.name: AquaConfigurationStatus
properties.description:
The value represents how the cluster is configured to use AQUA (Advanced Query Accelerator) after the cluster is restored. Possible values include the following.

enabled - Use AQUA if it is available for the current Region and Amazon Redshift node type.
disabled - Don't use AQUA.
auto - Amazon Redshift determines whether to use AQUA.

type.description:
The value represents how the cluster is configured to use AQUA (Advanced Query Accelerator) after the cluster is restored. Possible values include the following.

enabled - Use AQUA if it is available for the current Region and Amazon Redshift node type.
disabled - Don't use AQUA.
auto - Amazon Redshift determines whether to use AQUA.

properties.name: AutomatedSnapshotRetentionPeriod
properties.description: The number of days that automated snapshots are retained. If the value is 0, automated snapshots are disabled. Default value is 1

type.description: The number of days that automated snapshots are retained. If the value is 0, automated snapshots are disabled. Default value is 1

properties.name: AvailabilityZone
properties.description: The EC2 Availability Zone (AZ) in which you want Amazon Redshift to provision the cluster. Default: A random, system-chosen Availability Zone in the region that is specified by the endpoint

type.description: The EC2 Availability Zone (AZ) in which you want Amazon Redshift to provision the cluster. Default: A random, system-chosen Availability Zone in the region that is specified by the endpoint

properties.name: AvailabilityZoneRelocation
properties.description: The option to enable relocation for an Amazon Redshift cluster between Availability Zones after the cluster modification is complete.

type.description: The option to enable relocation for an Amazon Redshift cluster between Availability Zones after the cluster modification is complete.

properties.name: AvailabilityZoneRelocationStatus
properties.description: The availability zone relocation status of the cluster

type.description: The availability zone relocation status of the cluster

properties.name: Classic
properties.description: A boolean value indicating whether the resize operation is using the classic resize process. If you don't provide this parameter or set the value to false , the resize type is elastic.

type.description: A boolean value indicating whether the resize operation is using the classic resize process. If you don't provide this parameter or set the value to false , the resize type is elastic.

properties.name: ClusterIdentifier
properties.description: A unique identifier for the cluster. You use this identifier to refer to the cluster for any subsequent cluster operations such as deleting or modifying. All alphabetical characters must be lower case, no hypens at the end, no two consecutive hyphens. Cluster name should be unique for all clusters within an AWS account

type.description: A unique identifier for the cluster. You use this identifier to refer to the cluster for any subsequent cluster operations such as deleting or modifying. All alphabetical characters must be lower case, no hypens at the end, no two consecutive hyphens. Cluster name should be unique for all clusters within an AWS account

properties.name: ClusterParameterGroupName
properties.description: The name of the parameter group to be associated with this cluster.

type.description: The name of the parameter group to be associated with this cluster.

properties.name: ClusterSecurityGroups
properties.description: A list of security groups to be associated with this cluster.

type.description: A list of security groups to be associated with this cluster.

properties.name: ClusterSubnetGroupName
properties.description: The name of a cluster subnet group to be associated with this cluster.

type.description: The name of a cluster subnet group to be associated with this cluster.

properties.name: ClusterType
properties.description: The type of the cluster. When cluster type is specified as single-node, the NumberOfNodes parameter is not required and if multi-node, the NumberOfNodes parameter is required

type.description: The type of the cluster. When cluster type is specified as single-node, the NumberOfNodes parameter is not required and if multi-node, the NumberOfNodes parameter is required

properties.name: ClusterVersion
properties.description: The version of the Amazon Redshift engine software that you want to deploy on the cluster.The version selected runs on all the nodes in the cluster.

type.description: The version of the Amazon Redshift engine software that you want to deploy on the cluster.The version selected runs on all the nodes in the cluster.

properties.name: DBName
properties.description: The name of the first database to be created when the cluster is created. To create additional databases after the cluster is created, connect to the cluster with a SQL client and use SQL commands to create a database.

type.description: The name of the first database to be created when the cluster is created. To create additional databases after the cluster is created, connect to the cluster with a SQL client and use SQL commands to create a database.

properties.name: DeferMaintenance
properties.description: A boolean indicating whether to enable the deferred maintenance window.

type.description: A boolean indicating whether to enable the deferred maintenance window.

properties.name: DeferMaintenanceDuration
properties.description: An integer indicating the duration of the maintenance window in days. If you specify a duration, you can't specify an end time. The duration must be 45 days or less.

type.description: An integer indicating the duration of the maintenance window in days. If you specify a duration, you can't specify an end time. The duration must be 45 days or less.

properties.name: DeferMaintenanceEndTime
properties.description: A timestamp indicating end time for the deferred maintenance window. If you specify an end time, you can't specify a duration.

type.description: A timestamp indicating end time for the deferred maintenance window. If you specify an end time, you can't specify a duration.

properties.name: DeferMaintenanceStartTime
properties.description: A timestamp indicating the start time for the deferred maintenance window.

type.description: A timestamp indicating the start time for the deferred maintenance window.

properties.name: DestinationRegion
properties.description: The destination AWS Region that you want to copy snapshots to. Constraints: Must be the name of a valid AWS Region. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints in the Amazon Web Services [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#redshift_region] General Reference

type.description: The destination AWS Region that you want to copy snapshots to. Constraints: Must be the name of a valid AWS Region. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints in the Amazon Web Services [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#redshift_region] General Reference

properties.name: ElasticIp
properties.description: The Elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster.

type.description: The Elastic IP (EIP) address for the cluster.

properties.name: Encrypted
properties.description: If true, the data in the cluster is encrypted at rest.

type.description: If true, the data in the cluster is encrypted at rest.

properties.name: EnhancedVpcRouting
properties.description:
An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see Enhanced VPC Routing in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.

If this option is true , enhanced VPC routing is enabled.

Default: false

type.description:
An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see Enhanced VPC Routing in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.

If this option is true , enhanced VPC routing is enabled.

Default: false

properties.name: HsmClientCertificateIdentifier
properties.description: Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM

type.description: Specifies the name of the HSM client certificate the Amazon Redshift cluster uses to retrieve the data encryption keys stored in an HSM

properties.name: HsmConfigurationIdentifier
properties.description: Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.

type.description: Specifies the name of the HSM configuration that contains the information the Amazon Redshift cluster can use to retrieve and store keys in an HSM.

properties.name: IamRoles
properties.description: A list of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used by the cluster to access other AWS services. You must supply the IAM roles in their Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format. You can supply up to 50 IAM roles in a single request

type.description: A list of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that can be used by the cluster to access other AWS services. You must supply the IAM roles in their Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format. You can supply up to 50 IAM roles in a single request

properties.name: KmsKeyId
properties.description: The AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that you want to use to encrypt data in the cluster.

type.description: The AWS Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that you want to use to encrypt data in the cluster.

properties.name: MaintenanceTrackName
properties.description: The name for the maintenance track that you want to assign for the cluster. This name change is asynchronous. The new track name stays in the PendingModifiedValues for the cluster until the next maintenance window. When the maintenance track changes, the cluster is switched to the latest cluster release available for the maintenance track. At this point, the maintenance track name is applied.

type.description: The name for the maintenance track that you want to assign for the cluster. This name change is asynchronous. The new track name stays in the PendingModifiedValues for the cluster until the next maintenance window. When the maintenance track changes, the cluster is switched to the latest cluster release available for the maintenance track. At this point, the maintenance track name is applied.

properties.name: ManualSnapshotRetentionPeriod
properties.description:
The number of days to retain newly copied snapshots in the destination AWS Region after they are copied from the source AWS Region. If the value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.

The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.

type.description:
The number of days to retain newly copied snapshots in the destination AWS Region after they are copied from the source AWS Region. If the value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.

The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653.

properties.name: MasterUserPassword
properties.description: The password associated with the master user account for the cluster that is being created. Password must be between 8 and 64 characters in length, should have at least one uppercase letter.Must contain at least one lowercase letter.Must contain one number.Can be any printable ASCII character.

type.description: The password associated with the master user account for the cluster that is being created. Password must be between 8 and 64 characters in length, should have at least one uppercase letter.Must contain at least one lowercase letter.Must contain one number.Can be any printable ASCII character.

properties.name: MasterUsername
properties.description: The user name associated with the master user account for the cluster that is being created. The user name can't be PUBLIC and first character must be a letter.

type.description: The user name associated with the master user account for the cluster that is being created. The user name can't be PUBLIC and first character must be a letter.

properties.name: MultiAZ
properties.description: A boolean indicating if the redshift cluster is multi-az or not. If you don't provide this parameter or set the value to false, the redshift cluster will be single-az.

type.description: A boolean indicating if the redshift cluster is multi-az or not. If you don't provide this parameter or set the value to false, the redshift cluster will be single-az.

properties.name: NodeType
properties.description: The node type to be provisioned for the cluster.Valid Values: ds2.xlarge | ds2.8xlarge | dc1.large | dc1.8xlarge | dc2.large | dc2.8xlarge | ra3.4xlarge | ra3.16xlarge

type.description: The node type to be provisioned for the cluster.Valid Values: ds2.xlarge | ds2.8xlarge | dc1.large | dc1.8xlarge | dc2.large | dc2.8xlarge | ra3.4xlarge | ra3.16xlarge

properties.name: NumberOfNodes
properties.description: The number of compute nodes in the cluster. This parameter is required when the ClusterType parameter is specified as multi-node.

type.description: The number of compute nodes in the cluster. This parameter is required when the ClusterType parameter is specified as multi-node.

properties.name: Port
properties.description: The port number on which the cluster accepts incoming connections. The cluster is accessible only via the JDBC and ODBC connection strings

type.description: The port number on which the cluster accepts incoming connections. The cluster is accessible only via the JDBC and ODBC connection strings

properties.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
properties.description: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which automated cluster maintenance can occur.

type.description: The weekly time range (in UTC) during which automated cluster maintenance can occur.

properties.name: PubliclyAccessible
properties.description: If true, the cluster can be accessed from a public network.

type.description: If true, the cluster can be accessed from a public network.

properties.name: ResourceAction
properties.description: The Redshift operation to be performed. Resource Action supports pause-cluster, resume-cluster, failover-primary-compute APIs

type.description: The Redshift operation to be performed. Resource Action supports pause-cluster, resume-cluster, failover-primary-compute APIs

properties.name: RevisionTarget
properties.description: The identifier of the database revision. You can retrieve this value from the response to the DescribeClusterDbRevisions request.

type.description: The identifier of the database revision. You can retrieve this value from the response to the DescribeClusterDbRevisions request.

properties.name: RotateEncryptionKey
properties.description: A boolean indicating if we want to rotate Encryption Keys.

type.description: A boolean indicating if we want to rotate Encryption Keys.

properties.name: SnapshotClusterIdentifier
properties.description: The name of the cluster the source snapshot was created from. This parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the cluster name.

type.description: The name of the cluster the source snapshot was created from. This parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the cluster name.

properties.name: SnapshotCopyGrantName
properties.description: The name of the snapshot copy grant to use when snapshots of an AWS KMS-encrypted cluster are copied to the destination region.

type.description: The name of the snapshot copy grant to use when snapshots of an AWS KMS-encrypted cluster are copied to the destination region.

properties.name: SnapshotCopyManual
properties.description: Indicates whether to apply the snapshot retention period to newly copied manual snapshots instead of automated snapshots.

type.description: Indicates whether to apply the snapshot retention period to newly copied manual snapshots instead of automated snapshots.

properties.name: SnapshotCopyRetentionPeriod
properties.description:
The number of days to retain automated snapshots in the destination region after they are copied from the source region. 

 Default is 7. 

 Constraints: Must be at least 1 and no more than 35.

type.description:
The number of days to retain automated snapshots in the destination region after they are copied from the source region. 

 Default is 7. 

 Constraints: Must be at least 1 and no more than 35.

properties.name: SnapshotIdentifier
properties.description: The name of the snapshot from which to create the new cluster. This parameter isn't case sensitive.

type.description: The name of the snapshot from which to create the new cluster. This parameter isn't case sensitive.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: The list of tags for the cluster parameter group.

type.description: The list of tags for the cluster parameter group.

properties.name: VpcSecurityGroupIds
properties.description: A list of Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) security groups to be associated with the cluster.

type.description: A list of Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) security groups to be associated with the cluster.

attributes.description: An example resource schema demonstrating some basic constructs and validation rules.

properties.name: DeferMaintenanceIdentifier
properties.description: A unique identifier for the deferred maintenance window.

type.description: A unique identifier for the deferred maintenance window.
